item.title: A typical Perl project directory structure
item.description: A typical Perl project directory structure is designed to separate the main script(s) from modules, configurations, and other resources like tests or documentation. Here’s an example of a standard Perl project directory structure: my_perl_project/ ├── bin/ │ └── main.pl ├── lib/ │ ├── MyApp/ │ │ ├── Module1.pm │ │ └── Module2.pm ├── t/ │ ├── 01_module1.t │ └── 02_module2.t ├── script/ │ └── some_utility_script.pl ├── doc/ │ └── README.md ├── Makefile.

item.title: Using SQLITE database with Perl on OpenWRT
item.description: This article discusses using an SQLite database with Perl on the OpenWRT openwrt-23.05 branch (git-23.233.52805-dae2684). We aim to use an SQLite database with Perl.
